channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Man killed in accident on CTE
item.description:
June 06, 2020 1:22 PM

SINGAPORE - A man was killed in an accident on the Central Expressway (CTE) involving a black car on Saturday morning (June 6).

item.title: Two Sri Lankan men sentenced to 8 months' jail over forged Singapore passport, NRIC
item.description:
June 06, 2020 12:35 PM

SINGAPORE - Two Sri Lankan men have been jailed over forged Singapore documents.

item.title: Over $4.9m to be disbursed to mosques, Muslim organisations, madrasahs and other beneficiaries
item.description:
June 06, 2020 12:14 PM

SINGAPORE - Over $4.9 million of funds from the Muslim community will be distributed to mosques, Muslim organisations, madrasahs and other beneficiaries this year.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 6
item.description:
June 06, 2020 8:25 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Saturday, June 6.

item.title: Peranakan theatre pioneer, popiah shop owner among winners of Intangible Cultural Heritage Award
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

They are among the six winners of the inaugural award, honoured for making excellent contributions in passing on skills and knowledge in their fields.

item.title: Work begins on Quick Build Dorm in Choa Chu Kang
Singapore boosting capacity for fast Covid-19 vaccine production
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore is building up vaccine manufacturing capacity so production can be ramped up quickly and safely once a Covid-19 vaccine is found.

item.title: Fighting for wayang Peranakan
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

At 81, veteran female impersonator G.T. Lye is still fighting for the art of wayang Peranakan.

item.title: No plan to treat Covid-19 patients in Singapore with hydroxychloroquine
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore does not plan to use hydroxychloroquine to treat patients with Covid-19, even though the World Health Organisation (WHO) plans to restart the trial of this drug.

item.title: Coronavirus: Biomedical manufacturing a bright spot for Singapore
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's investments in biomedical sciences have paid off during the Covid-19 pandemic, with the biomedical manufacturing sector remaining a bright spot in a sluggish economy.

item.title: Nurturing young enthusiasts
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

More than just performance, Teochew opera is a conduit for transmitting traditional culture and values, such as filial piety, to the young.

item.title: Help for graduating students affected by Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Many internships have been disrupted by the recent circuit breaker measures to curb the spread of Covid-19, and this has posed a challenge for students in institutes of higher learning (IHLs), Education Minister Ong Ye Kung acknowledged in Parliament yesterday.

item.title: NDP 2020 a rallying point for Singapore
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Just as Singapore's founding generations held the National Day Parade (NDP) to signify the collective confidence in the future, Singaporeans should celebrate National Day this year precisely because the country faces even more challenging times ahead, said Defence Minister Ng Eng Hen yesterday.

item.title: Serving up a taste of Singapore
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Thanks to Mr Michael Ker, 44, even people living in New York and Copenhagen have tasted a much-loved Singaporean dish: the popiah.

item.title: PA chief executive director to step down, leave public service
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

The People's Association's (PA) chief executive director Desmond Tan Kok Ming will step down and leave the public service on June 15, fuelling speculation that he could enter politics at the upcoming general election.

item.title: National Day packs for 80% of Singaporean and PR households
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Funpacks for about 80 per cent of all Singaporean and permanent resident households will be produced by the National Day Parade (NDP) executive committee, after taking into account those who said they do not need one.

item.title: Coral reefs in Singapore could have been growing for 7,000 years
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

As Singapore evolved from a sleepy coastal village into the world's second busiest port, the coral reefs around it were keeping a silent record of the changes underwater.

item.title: Breathing new life into dragon kiln
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

A third-generation family pottery business, Thow Kwang Industry has been trying to engage different audiences to share its craft and explore ways to digitalise.

item.title: Govt agencies allowed to obtain Covid-19 supplies without tender
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Goods and services needed to fight the Covid-19 pandemic can be obtained by government agencies without calling for a tender, owing to the urgency of the situation, two ministers said yesterday.

item.title: World Oceans Day: Looking out for coral reefs during Covid-19 and beyond
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Ocean health is human health.

item.title: Agri-tech firm used circuit breaker period to recharge
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Local agri-tech company Shiok Meats may have been at minimal operations during the circuit breaker period, but it has used the time to recharge as it works towards commercialisation.

item.title: Putting fresh spin on tradition
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Trying to stay up to date and yet true to its roots, Apsaras Arts has blended strict adherence to Indian classical dance techniques with contemporary storytelling.

item.title: GIC, Temasek provide loans in context of investment: Indranee
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's GIC and Temasek provide loans to companies in the context of investment, and the Government does not direct these decisions, said Minister in the Prime Minister's Office Indranee Rajah in Parliament yesterday.

item.title: Turning washed-up plastic trash into valuable resource
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Plastic bottles, takeaway containers and grocery bags. Each year, tonnes of such plastic waste find their way onto the shores of Singapore, and there are few satisfactory ways of recycling them.

item.title: Moving up to new role after 19 years as ops exec
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Chew Kok Poh had worked in ST Logistics as an operations executive in warehouse operations for close to 19 years.

item.title: Keeping Malay art forms alive
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Malay performing arts group Sri Warisan is making heritage "glow", said its founder and Cultural Medallion winner Som Said, 69.

item.title: Malay-Muslims have responded well to Covid-19 challenges: Masagos
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

By responding with unity, resilience and compassion to disruptions brought about by the Covid-19 pandemic, the Malay-Muslim community here has demonstrated how it is a community of success, said Mr Masagos Zulkifli, Minister-in-charge of Muslim Affairs, yesterday.

item.title: Nature's tweets: Listen to songs of native birds as S'pore hums back to life
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

This small parrot has bright green feathers and a dark blue crown on its head. Originally a forest species, it has become increasingly common in Singapore over the past decade, and can be seen in urban greenery in the Central Business District and Orchard Road, said Dr Yong.

item.title: Setting up safe management measures will pay off for firms: Chan
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Implementing safe management measures at the workplace will incur some added cost and inconvenience for businesses, but it will pay off in the long run and speed up the reopening of the rest of the economy, Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing said yesterday.

item.title: Mobile kiosks boost efficiency at community care facilities
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

A system of mobile kiosks, which allow Covid-19 patients at community care facilities (CCF) to take their own vital signs readings, is among several ways technology has aided Singapore's fight against the pandemic, said the head of the national technology agency for public healthcare.

item.title: The global Covid-19 vaccine race
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

The genome of Sars-CoV-2, the virus which causes Covid-19, was sequenced on Jan 11, less than two months after the first cases of atypical pneumonia were reported in Wuhan, China.

item.title: Coronavirus: Expect some price fluctuations for staples in supermarkets
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans should expect some fluctuations in prices of supermarket staples due to global supply disruptions amid the Covid-19 pandemic, Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing said yesterday.

item.title: Court rules hotpot restaurant liable for canister blast injuring diner
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

A diner who suffered burns from an exploding gas canister at a hotpot restaurant will be compensated after a judge held the restaurant negligent.

item.title: More seem keen on mortgage refinancing as interest rates fall
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

More home owners may be considering refinancing their mortgages, as banks' interest rates for floating home loans are at their lowest in recent years.

item.title: Hospitals going back to business as usual
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

As the number of hospitalised Covid-19 patients here continues to fall steadily, hospitals are cautiously turning their Covid-19 wards back into regular ones.

item.title: Graduating students urged to stay positive
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Graduating students looking for full-time jobs in the post-Covid-19 job market are likely to face significant challenges.

item.title: Firm's $1.5m investment to refurbish facility pays off
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore-headquartered precision engineering firm Forefront Medical embarked on its trans-formation journey some 18 months ago, putting in $1.5 million to refurbish the clean rooms at its facility here.

item.title: 95-year-old Singaporean woman among 11 new coronavirus cases in community
item.description:
June 06, 2020 5:00 AM

Two Singaporean women, aged 95 and 65, are among the 11 new community Covid-19 cases yesterday.
